title: CVPR_2004_18_abs

sentences.text: The automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts requires shape information since low-level feature analysis alone often fails to reach this goal .
We introduce a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation which is based on mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture as well as probabilistic shape knowledge .
The combined approach is formulated in the framework of Bayesian statistics to account for the robust-ness requirement in image understanding .
Experimental evidence shows that semantically meaningful segments are inferred , even when image data alone gives rise to ambiguous segmentations .

aliases: a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation
Entity-a_novel_method_of_shape_constrain.description: A Bayesian-based approach that combines feature distributions for color, texture, and shape to segment images into semantically meaningful parts.

mentions.local_name: a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation

Entity-we_introduce_a_novel_method.description: A new approach to shape-constrained image segmentation that combines Bayesian statistics with mixtures of feature distributions for color, texture, and probabilistic shape knowledge.

Entity-the_automated_segmentation.description: A method for segmenting images into semantically meaningful parts that incorporates shape information and probabilistic knowledge.

mentions.local_name: to account for the robust-ness requirement in image understanding

summary: The automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts requires shape information since low-level feature analysis alone often fails to reach this goal . We introduce a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation which is based on mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture as well as probabilistic shape knowledge . The combined approach is formulated in the framework of Bayesian statistics to account for the robust-ness requirement in image understanding . Experimental evidence shows that semantically meaningful segments are inferred , even when image data alone gives rise to ambiguous segmentations .

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: Indicates that something (the subject) needs or necessitates another thing (the object), often implying a condition for its proper functioning, operation, or existence.

Predicate-introduce.label: introduce
Predicate-introduce.description: To introduce means to bring forth or present something new, often for consideration, discussion, or implementation. The predicate 'introduce' connects the subject (the entity introducing) with an object that represents a novel concept, idea, method, person, etc., highlighting the act of making it known or available.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' indicates a relationship where the subject's foundation or justification lies with the object. It suggests that the subject's existence, validity, or methodology relies heavily on the principles, concepts, or data provided by the object.

Predicate-is_formulated_in.label: is formulated in
Predicate-is_formulated_in.description: The predicate 'is formulated in' indicates that the subject (a concept, idea, or methodology) has its underlying structure, principles, or framework defined within a specific object (e.g., mathematical theory, programming language, scientific discipline). In general, this predicate highlights the connection between an abstract entity and the formal system or paradigm that governs it.

Predicate-is_formulated_in_the_framework.label: is formulated in the framework of
Predicate-is_formulated_in_the_framework.description: This predicate indicates that the subject's concept or idea is structured and organized according to the principles, theories, or methodologies outlined by the object. In other words, it describes how a particular approach, method, or framework has been used as a foundation for developing or understanding the subject.

Predicate-are_inferred.label: are inferred
Predicate-are_inferred.description: The predicate 'are inferred' indicates a process of logical or intuitive reasoning where conclusions about the object (semantically meaningful segments) are drawn based on available information, evidence, or context. The subject (Experimental evidence shows that...) provides the foundation for making these inferences.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. It establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
